III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was attempting to AWOLP, and a staff put their arm up to
block the youth. The staff put their arm around the youth's
shoulder to keep the youth from leaving. The youth received a
scratch on the neck from the staff.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/3/2024. Youth A reported he was upset and tried to walk out of
the cafeteria and Staff 1 “grabbed my neck” and demonstrated by
grabbing the collar of his shirt, to stop him from walking out of the
facility. When Staff 1 “grabbed” Youth A’s collar, Youth A
continued walking away and then turned back toward Staff 1 at
which time Staff 1’s nail went into Youth A’s neck. Youth A
reported Staff 1 was standing on his left side when this occurred
and had her right hand on his collar/neck area. Youth A reported
he told Staff 1 her nail went into his neck. Staff 1 told Youth A she
“did not care”. Youth A left the building and wanted to call
Children’s Protective Services. Youth A went to the Human
Resource building and was brought back to the facility however he
did not recall who brought him back. Youth A reported Staff 1
apologized to him. Youth A reported there was another incident
involving Staff 1. Youth A was in the coordinator’s office with Staff
1. Youth A was upset. Youth A was refusing to leave the
coordinator’s office. Youth A reported Staff 1 grabbed the arm of
the chair he was sitting in to get Youth A out of the chair at which
time Youth A fell to the ground. Youth A then left the coordinator’s
office. Youth A could not remember when this occurred however
thought it was one to two months ago after Thanksgiving. Youth A
reported “it happened in a blind spot”. Youth A reported a “blind
spot” is where there are no cameras. Youth A reported no other
staff or youth witnessed it. Youth A did not tell anyone about this
incident. Youth A did not have any injuries from this. Youth A
reported he did not have any other concerns to report. Consultant
ended the interview. As Consultant was leaving the facility, Youth
A approached Consultant in the parking lot and asked Consultant
to call the police for him and stated, “the staff keep putting their
2

hands on me, I want to report them.” Youth A was being followed
by staff and was referred to his staff who were with him. Youth A
did not report any other concerns about staff “putting their hands”
on him during the interview with Consultant.
Staff 1/Complainant was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 1/3/2024. Staff 1 was in the cafeteria when Youth A
and Staff 2 came into the cafeteria. Youth A was upset and has a
pattern of going AWOLP (absent without legal permission) when
he is upset. Youth A came out of the hallway into the cafeteria
and Staff 1 reported she attempted to use her body to try to block
Youth A from moving past her. Staff 1 put her arm out to stop
Youth A and her fingernail “caught” Youth A’s neck. Staff 1
reported she put her arm up in “a caring gesture to redirect” Youth
A’s movement. Staff 1 reported she did not “grab” Youth A’s collar
of his shirt or any part of his body. Staff 1 reported her hand was
open when she put her arm out. Staff 1 placed her arm out and
her arm was across Youth A’s back. Youth A turned his body
toward Staff 1 causing Staff 1’s arm and hand to slide across
Youth A’s back and neck. Staff 1 reported Youth A began stating
Staff 1 scratched him and ran out of the building. Staff 1 reported
Youth A’s neck was looked at by Staff 2 after the incident and a
picture was taken. Youth A did not have a scratch or any mark on
his neck from Staff 1’s fingernail. Staff 1 reported the facility
policy for when a youth is attempting to AWOLP is to try to stop
and deter the youth from leaving the building by using the
communication continuum and verbal prompts. Staff 1 reported
she was not trying to restrain Youth A. Staff 1 reported Youth A
was on a safety plan in December due to his leaving the facility
and Staff 1 did not know if Youth A was still on the safety plan as
she had been off work from December 11-25, 2023. Staff 1
reported if a youth does not follow the verbal prompts from staff to
deter the youth from leaving the facility, staff are to let the youth
go and follow the youth. Staff 1 reported she thought she had a
good rapport with Youth A and that is why she put her arm out “in
a caring gesture” to try to “block” him from leaving. Staff 1
reported the coordinator’s office is always locked as there are
medications in the office. Staff 1 reported there was never an
incident with Youth A being in the coordinator’s office and refusing
to leave. Staff 1 reported she never pulled a chair from Youth A
causing him to fall. Staff 1 reported she has not been in the
coordinator’s office with Youth A. Staff 1 reported the incident to
centralized intake due to Youth A stating he was calling Children’s
Protective Services about the incident.
3

Staff 2/Complainant was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 1/3/2024. Youth A was in the cafeteria trying to leave
the facility. Staff 1 attempted to stop Youth A from going out the
door by getting in front of Youth A with her arms out. Staff 2 never
saw Staff 1 dig her fingernail or scratch Youth A. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 never had a hold of Youth A. Staff 1’s hands were open
when she had her arms out to stop Youth A. Youth A left the
building and went outside. Youth A wanted to call Children’s
Protective Services and was stating Staff 1 scratched him. Staff 2
was able to see Youth A’s neck and take a picture. Staff 2
reported Youth A did not have any scratches or marks on his
neck. Youth A walked to the Human Resource building. Staff 2
was with Youth A and brought him back to the facility where she
assisted Youth A in attempting to contact his MDHHS worker.
Youth A’s MDHHS worker was not available and the MDHHS on-
call worker suggested Staff 2 call Centralized Intake. Staff 2
reported the facilities policy and procedure regarding when youth
are trying to leave the facility directs staff not to physically hold a
youth to prevent the youth from leaving. Staff are trained to try to
block the door or use proximity control with their body and try to
verbally redirect the youth. Staff 2 reported she did not have any
knowledge about an incident with Youth A having a chair pulled
out from under him by Staff 1. Staff 2 reported she was not
concerned with how Staff 1 handled the incident.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/3/2024.
Staff 3 reported Youth A ran off his unit and Staff 1 tried to stop
him in the cafeteria by putting her arms out. Staff 3 did not see
Staff 1’s arms make contact with Youth A’s body. Staff 3 reported
the incident happened so fast. Youth A then continued running
and ran down to unit 4 and out the facility door. Staff 3 followed
Youth A outside. Youth A wanted to call Children’s Protective
Services because Staff 1 “tried to choke” him and put her
fingernails in his neck. Youth A continued walking outside the
facility and walked to the Human Resource building to call
Children’s Protective Services. Staff 2 took Youth A to her office to
call Children’s Protective Services. Staff 3 reported she had no
concerns with the incident she saw. Facility policy trains staff to
talk calmly to youth when they are escalated and attempting to
leave the facility. Staff are to give the youth options on what they
can do. Facility policy trains staff to use their body to block the
youth from leaving the facility while trying to talk to the youth. Staff
3 reported Youth A has never disclosed any information to her
regarding being in a chair and Staff 1 pulling the chair causing him
to fall.
4

Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 12/29/2023 in the cafeteria was reviewed on
1/3/2024. Staff 1 is in the cafeteria near the hallway leading into
the cafeteria. Youth A comes into the cafeteria behind Staff 1.
Staff 2 was following Youth A. Staff 1 turns sideways and Youth A
tries to walk quickly around Staff 1. Staff 1 puts her right arm out
and it appears her right hand is on Youth A’s left bicep area.
Youth A quickly turns to face Staff 1 and Staff 1’s arm/hand moves
up to Youth A’s left side of his neck. Youth A continues moving
away from Staff 1 and Staff 1 is moving with Youth A with her
hand near Youth A’s neck. Staff 1 is able to get in front of Youth A
and her arms move to her side and slightly out. Staff 1 is standing
in front of Youth A and Youth A attempts to move around Staff 1.
Staff 1 moves with Youth A to keep him in front of her. Youth A
gets around Staff 1 and is side by side with Staff 1. Staff 1 is
walking side by side with Youth A for a few steps and Youth A
begins to run down the hall.
Documents Reviewed:
• Behavior Notification dated 12/29/2023 at 11:42am: At
11:20am Youth A became upset and stormed out of Unit 1
into the cafeteria and headed towards the side door. Staff 1
attempted to stop Youth A and Youth A went outside upset
calling Staff 1 names. Youth A went to the Human
Resources office and was demanding to call Children’s
Protective Services.
• Behavior Notification dated 12/29/2023 at 12:30pm: Youth
A threatened to call Children’s Protective Services on Staff
1 stating she had put her hands on him. Youth A stated,
“I’m a get that bitch fired.”
• Wolverine Human Services (WHS) Truancy Policy and
Procedure: Staff will make efforts to verbally redirect the
truanting client and will offer the client support and
alternatives to truancy. Staff will not physically intervene
with the client on WHS property other than in accordance
with therapeutic crisis intervention (TCI) protocol regarding
danger to self or others.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
related to physical intervention. Staff 1 received truancy
training on 6/28/2023 and CPI Non-Violent Crisis
Intervention on 3/30/2023.
• Staff 1 Safety Plan dated 12/29/2023-1/29/2024: Staff 1 is
not to be alone with Youth A at any time. If Staff 1 must be
in proximity of Youth A, another staff must be in arm’s
5

length of Staff 1. Staff 1 should not be involved in any
physical management of Youth A.
• Youth A’s Safety Plan dated December 8, 2023: Youth A
was placed on a safety watch due to comments made
towards staff and his increasingly aggressive behavior. Pay
attention when Youth A is near doors and be prepared to
follow him. The safety plan states it will be re-evaluated on
December 11, 2023.
• Picture of Youth A’s neck from 12/29/2023 taken by Staff 2.
Youth A did not have any scratch or mark on his neck per
the picture.
• CPI Training Manual: Non-verbal communication: Use of
touch as appropriate to show support through touch such
as placing a hand on the youths shoulder or their hand.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as the facilities CPI model
utilizes nonverbal communication as a verbal de-escalation tool
and use of touch as an appropriate way to show support by
placing a hand on the youth’s shoulder or their hand. The facility
followed their internal policy as Staff 1 placed her arm out and
hand on Youth A’s shoulder.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It is recommended the facility updated their internal policy to
reflect the facilities approved restraint model as the policy
indicates TCI and the facility is now using CPI.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
